title: How to Make Corn Pudding

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 400° Fahrenheit (204° Celsius).
Grease a 3-quart baking dish with non-sticking cooking spray.
Add the cans of corn and eggs into a large bowl.
In a separate small bowl, combine the dry ingredients.
steps.description: Fully whisk the sugar, seasoned salt, cornstarch, seasoned salt, and minced onion.

steps.headline: Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Combine well until the ingredients are fully incorporated.

steps.headline: Fold in the milk and butter and mix once more.
Bake the corn pudding for about an hour.
steps.description: To keep the entire corn pudding golden brown, stir it once or twice with a spoon while it's baking. The corn pudding is ready to be removed when the sides are golden brown, but the pudding itself is still soft.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Scoop the corn pudding onto a dish or bowl. Garnish with shredded cheese or bacon bits, if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 325° Fahrenheit (165° Celsius).
Grease a 3-quart baking dish with non-sticking cooking spray.
In a medium-sized bowl, cream the butter and sugar for about 2 minutes.
steps.description: Mix well with an electric mixer until the mixture is light and fluffy.

steps.headline: Crack in the eggs, adding them one at a time.
steps.description: Beat once more until fully combined.

steps.headline: Pour in the sour cream and cornbread mix.
Fold in the milk and corn into the batter.
steps.description: Blend one last time, making sure the ingredients are fully incorporated.

steps.headline: Bake the corn pudding for about 45-50 minutes.
steps.description: The top of the corn pudding should resemble a golden brown color and fully set when it's ready to be removed from the heat.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Scoop the corn pudding onto a dish or bowl. Garnish with shredded cheese or bacon bits, if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Grease a 3 or 4 quart slow-cooker with non-stick cooking spray.
steps.description: Be sure to spray all the corners and inside areas of the slow-cooker to prevent food from sticking onto it.

steps.headline: Pour both cans of corn, the sour cream, and butter into the slow-cooker.
Add the cornbread mix and bacon bits.
steps.description: Stir well with a wooden spoon until fully incorporated together.

steps.headline: Cook the corn pudding on low heat for about 4-5 hours.
steps.description: Be sure the slow-cooker is covered while the pudding cooks. When the corn pudding begins to thicken it up, it is ready to be removed.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Scoop the corn pudding onto a dish or bowl. Garnish with shredded cheese or extra bacon bits, if desired. Enjoy!

text: Classic Corn Pudding Preheat the oven to 400° Fahrenheit (204° Celsius).  Grease a 3-quart baking dish with non-sticking cooking spray.  Add the cans of corn and eggs into a large bowl. Whisk well until fully combined. In a separate small bowl, combine the dry ingredients. Fully whisk the sugar, seasoned salt, cornstarch, seasoned salt, and minced onion. Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients. Combine well until the ingredients are fully incorporated. Fold in the milk and butter and mix once more.  Bake the corn pudding for about an hour. To keep the entire corn pudding golden brown, stir it once or twice with a spoon while it's baking. The corn pudding is ready to be removed when the sides are golden brown, but the pudding itself is still soft. Serve. Scoop the corn pudding onto a dish or bowl. Garnish with shredded cheese or bacon bits, if desired. Enjoy! Easy Corn Pudding Preheat the oven to 325° Fahrenheit (165° Celsius).  Grease a 3-quart baking dish with non-sticking cooking spray.  In a medium-sized bowl, cream the butter and sugar for about 2 minutes. Mix well with an electric mixer until the mixture is light and fluffy. Crack in the eggs, adding them one at a time. Beat once more until fully combined. Pour in the sour cream and cornbread mix. Blend well until fully mixed. Fold in the milk and corn into the batter. Blend one last time, making sure the ingredients are fully incorporated. Bake the corn pudding for about 45-50 minutes. The top of the corn pudding should resemble a golden brown color and fully set when it's ready to be removed from the heat. Serve. Scoop the corn pudding onto a dish or bowl. Garnish with shredded cheese or bacon bits, if desired. Enjoy! Slow-Cooker Corn Pudding Grease a 3 or 4 quart slow-cooker with non-stick cooking spray. Be sure to spray all the corners and inside areas of the slow-cooker to prevent food from sticking onto it. Pour both cans of corn, the sour cream, and butter into the slow-cooker.  Add the cornbread mix and bacon bits. Stir well with a wooden spoon until fully incorporated together. Cook the corn pudding on low heat for about 4-5 hours. Be sure the slow-cooker is covered while the pudding cooks. When the corn pudding begins to thicken it up, it is ready to be removed. Serve. Scoop the corn pudding onto a dish or bowl. Garnish with shredded cheese or extra bacon bits, if desired. Enjoy!
